Sentencas: This paper focuses on the optimization of Jet-A fuel reforming for use with solid-oxide fuel cells in aerospace applications.
Titulo: Optimization of Jet-A fuel reforming for aerospace applications

Sentencas: Because of the specialized operating conditions and reforming requirements, a broad range of reforming inlet conditions need to be considered.
Titulo: Optimization of Jet-A fuel reforming for aerospace applications

Sentencas: Both equilibrium calculations for reforming of a Jet-A surrogate and zero-dimensional modeling with detailed chemistry for reforming of a kerosene surrogate are performed over a wide range of conditions with varying inlet temperature, operating pressure, steam-to-carbon ratio, and oxygen-to-carbon ratio.
Titulo: Optimization of Jet-A fuel reforming for aerospace applications

Sentencas: While equilibrium calculations provide some insight into the efficiency of the final reformer, the kinetics modeling can account for the finite residence time of the gas within the reformer.
Titulo: Optimization of Jet-A fuel reforming for aerospace applications

Sentencas: Calculations using finite-rate gas-phase chemistry indicate that the most efficient mode of reforming is achieved using a short-contact partial oxidation reactor operating with minimal water addition.
Titulo: Optimization of Jet-A fuel reforming for aerospace applications

Sentencas: Certain factors to consider for the development of a future catalytic reformer, such as local hot-spots and coke deposition on the catalyst, are also discussed.
Titulo: Optimization of Jet-A fuel reforming for aerospace applications
